      • derivsThatMinimizeChiSqSum

        public static void derivsThatMinimizeChiSqSum(float[] vars,
                                              float[] varsMin,
                                              float[] varsMax,
                                              float[] chiSqSumReturn,
                                              float[] x,
                                              float[] normalizedY,
                                              float[] normalizedYErr,
                                              float[] r,
                                              int idx0,
                                              int idx1)
        for given mu, k, sigma and the data x, normalizedY and normalizedYErr, calculate the changes in k, sigma, and mu which would reduce the chi sq sum. Note that internally, the first and second derivatives of the curve GEV(k, sigma, mu) are used to calculate what the smallest step in k, sigma, or mu would be in order to create a significant change in the GEV curve. The suggested change for k is calculated from d/dk modified by the preconditioner at the point right after the model peak. Note that the suggested changes might be applied by the NonQuadraticConguteSolver as a fraction of the suggested change. runtime cost is
        Parameters:
        vars - array of current values of k, sigma, and mu
        varsMin - array of minimum allowed values of k, sigma, and mu
        varsMax - array of maximum allowed values of k, sigma, and mu
        chiSqSumReturn - item [0] is the best current chiSqSum for given vars. item [1] is to return the value of the best chiSqSum here to the invoker if r was set to non-zero values.
        x - normalized x values of histogram to fit
        r - the array to pass back values to be added to vars found by this method. the items are ordered so that index=0 holds delta k, index=1 holds delta sigma, index=2 holds delta mu. the values may be zero if no step was found to improve the chi square sum.
        normalizedY -
        normalizedYErr -
        idx0 - start of index within derivs, inclusive, to use in solution. index 0 = k, index 1 = sigma, index 2 = mu
        idx1 - stop of index within derivs, inclusive, to use in solution. index 0 = k, index 1 = sigma, index 2 = mu

                                     float mu,

      • estimateDY2DKDK

        public static double estimateDY2DKDK(float yConst,
                                     float mu,
                                     float k,
                                     float sigma,
                                     float x,
                                     double dydk)
        estimate ∂2/∂k∂k, that is ∂2/∂k∂k empirically. the method accepts dydk as a given to allow easier resuse in other equations, but has to trust that dydk was derived with the same k, sigma, mu, and x.
        Parameters:
        yConst -
        mu -
        k -
        sigma -
        x -
        dydk -
        Returns:
